title: Revelation Chapter 17 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Revelation chapter 17 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Revelation Chapter 17 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Revelation Chapter 17.

questions.question: Who came and talked with John in Revelation 17:1?
options: One of the seven angels with the seven vials
questions.correctAnswer: One of the seven angels with the seven vials
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:1 states that one of the seven angels who had the seven vials came and talked with John.

questions.question: According to Revelation 17:2, with whom have the kings of the earth committed fornication?
questions.correctAnswer: The great whore
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:2 says the kings of the earth have committed fornication with the great whore.

questions.question: In Revelation 17:3, what was the woman sitting upon?
questions.correctAnswer: A scarlet coloured beast
questions.explanation: Verse 3 describes the woman as sitting upon a scarlet coloured beast.

questions.question: What colors was the woman arrayed in according to Revelation 17:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Purple and scarlet
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:4 says the woman was arrayed in purple and scarlet colour.

questions.question: What was written on the woman’s forehead in Revelation 17:5?
options: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH
questions.correctAnswer: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH
questions.explanation: Verse 5 clearly states this name was written on the woman's forehead.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 17:6 describes the woman as being drunken with the blood of the saints and martyrs of Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 6 specifically mentions the woman being drunken with the blood of the saints and martyrs of Jesus.

questions.question: According to Revelation 17:8, what is said about the beast that was, and is not?
options: It shall ascend out of the bottomless pit and go into perdition
It is an angel of God
It is the Lamb of God
questions.correctAnswer: It shall ascend out of the bottomless pit and go into perdition
questions.explanation: Verse 8 describes the beast as ascending out of the bottomless pit and going into perdition.

questions.question: How many heads does the beast have as mentioned in Revelation 17:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states the beast has seven heads.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The seven heads are seven ______, on which the woman sitteth (Revelation 17:9).
questions.correctAnswer: mountains
questions.explanation: Verse 9 identifies the seven heads as seven mountains.

questions.question: According to Revelation 17:10, how many kings are there?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven
questions.explanation: Verse 10 speaks of seven kings in total.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 17:12 says the ten horns are ten kings who have already received their kingdoms.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 12 actually says the ten kings have received no kingdom yet but will receive power for a short time.

questions.question: What will the ten kings do to the woman according to Revelation 17:16?
options: Make her desolate and naked, eat her flesh, and burn her with fire
Protect her and give her riches
questions.correctAnswer: Make her desolate and naked, eat her flesh, and burn her with fire
questions.explanation: Verse 16 describes the ten horns hating the whore and making her desolate and naked, eating her flesh, and burning her with fire.

questions.question: What are the waters on which the whore sitteth, as explained in Revelation 17:15?
questions.correctAnswer: Peoples, multitudes, nations, and tongues
questions.explanation: Verse 15 clarifies that the waters represent peoples, multitudes, nations, and tongues.

questions.question: Who will overcome the ten kings that make war with the Lamb according to Revelation 17:14?
questions.correctAnswer: The Lamb
questions.explanation: Verse 14 states that the Lamb shall overcome the ten kings who make war with Him.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 17:18 identifies the woman as that great city which reigneth over the kings of the earth.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 18 identifies the woman as the great city reigning over the kings of the earth.

medium.title: Revelation Chapter 17 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Revelation Chapter 17 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with temptation to compromise their faith for worldly gain. Based on Revelation 17, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God instead?
options: The Lamb will overcome the worldly powers and is Lord of lords and King of kings
The woman on the beast represents faithfulness to God
The ten kings will protect the whore from harm
The beast is the source of true blessing
questions.correctAnswer: The Lamb will overcome the worldly powers and is Lord of lords and King of kings
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:14 teaches that the Lamb shall overcome those who oppose God, emphasizing trust in God's ultimate victory over worldly temptations and powers.

questions.question: How does Revelation 17 teach about perseverance through trials and opposition faced by believers?
options: The woman is drunken with the blood of the saints and martyrs but believers are called and faithful
The beast will give believers power over the earth
The kings will protect the woman from harm
The ten horns will bless the saints
questions.correctAnswer: The woman is drunken with the blood of the saints and martyrs but believers are called and faithful
questions.explanation: Verses 6 and 14 show believers face persecution but are chosen and faithful, encouraging perseverance despite suffering.

questions.question: In the context of church life and fellowship, what warning does Revelation 17 give about compromising with worldly powers?
options: The kings of the earth committed fornication with the great whore, showing compromise with evil
The Lamb calls all to join the kings
The beast is a protector of the church
The woman is a symbol of pure church
questions.correctAnswer: The kings of the earth committed fornication with the great whore, showing compromise with evil
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:2 warns against believers or leaders compromising with corrupt worldly systems, as the kings committed fornication with the great whore.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged because worldly powers seem strong and victorious. What biblical truth from Revelation 17 would encourage them to remain humble and faithful?
options: The beast that was and is not will ultimately go into perdition
The woman reigns eternally over the earth
The ten horns will give eternal power to the beast
questions.correctAnswer: The beast that was and is not will ultimately go into perdition
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:8 and 17:11 clarify that the beast’s power is temporary and destined for destruction, encouraging humility and trust in God's sovereignty.

questions.question: How does Revelation 17 instruct believers to view material wealth and adornment in light of spiritual truth?
options: The woman is decked with gold, precious stones, and pearls but is full of abominations, warning against trusting in riches
Wealth is a sign of God’s favor
The beast is clothed in riches and holiness
Kings are adorned to show their spiritual power
questions.correctAnswer: The woman is decked with gold, precious stones, and pearls but is full of abominations, warning against trusting in riches
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:4 shows the woman’s outward adornment contrasts with her inner filthiness, teaching believers to prioritize spiritual integrity over material wealth.

questions.question: A Christian parent wants to teach their children about avoiding spiritual deception. What lesson from Revelation 17 would you share?
options: The great whore represents spiritual deception that entices many peoples and nations
The beast is a model of godly leadership
The ten horns will bless the children of believers
The woman is a symbol of pure faith
questions.correctAnswer: The great whore represents spiritual deception that entices many peoples and nations
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:1-2 and 15 describe the great whore as influencing many peoples and nations, teaching the need for vigilance against spiritual deception.

questions.question: How does Revelation 17 encourage believers to maintain honesty and integrity in daily life amidst corrupt systems?
options: The kings and rulers give power to the beast but believers are called and faithful, showing the importance of faithfulness over compromise
The woman rules justly over the earth
The beast rewards those who follow him
The ten horns bring peace through compromise
questions.correctAnswer: The kings and rulers give power to the beast but believers are called and faithful, showing the importance of faithfulness over compromise
questions.explanation: Verses 12-14 reveal worldly powers align with evil, but believers are called to remain faithful and chosen, highlighting integrity in opposition to corruption.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 17 teaches that God’s will is ultimately fulfilled even through the actions of corrupt rulers and kingdoms.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:17 states God puts it into the hearts of the kings to fulfill His will, showing God’s sovereign control over all events.

questions.question: True or False: The woman described in Revelation 17 is called 'The Mother of Harlots and Abominations of the Earth' because she represents faithful churches worldwide.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:5 identifies the woman as 'Mystery, Babylon the Great, the Mother of Harlots and Abominations,' symbolizing corrupt spiritual systems, not faithful churches.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The woman in Revelation 17 sits upon a ________ beast with seven heads and ten horns.
questions.correctAnswer: scarlet
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:3 describes the woman sitting on a scarlet coloured beast, symbolizing the corrupt power she rides.

questions.question: How does the passage in Revelation 17 illustrate the importance of prayer and spiritual discernment in recognizing evil influences?
options: The angel tells John to use wisdom to understand the seven mountains and kings, indicating the need for spiritual discernment
The woman is praised for her beauty and influence
The beast is a sign of God’s blessing
The kings are hidden and unknowable
questions.correctAnswer: The angel tells John to use wisdom to understand the seven mountains and kings, indicating the need for spiritual discernment
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:9 calls for wisdom to understand the symbolism, encouraging believers to seek spiritual insight through prayer and study.

questions.question: A believer is feeling prideful because of their influence in the church. What does Revelation 17 teach about humility related to earthly power?
options: The beast that was and is not will ultimately be destroyed, showing that earthly power is temporary
The woman is described as the eternal ruler
The ten horns will reign forever with the beast
questions.correctAnswer: The beast that was and is not will ultimately be destroyed, showing that earthly power is temporary
questions.explanation: Verses 8 and 11 emphasize the beast’s temporary existence and ultimate destruction, reminding believers to remain humble before God.

questions.question: What does Revelation 17 teach about love for neighbors in the context of spiritual warfare and opposition?
options: Believers are called and chosen to overcome evil with faithfulness, implying they should love and serve others even in trials
The woman and kings will destroy all opposition
The beast encourages hatred among believers
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are called and chosen to overcome evil with faithfulness, implying they should love and serve others even in trials
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:14 highlights the Lamb’s victory and the faithful called to Him, teaching believers to persevere in love and service despite opposition.

questions.question: How does Revelation 17 guide believers in stewardship and generosity amidst corrupt influences?
options: The abominations in the golden cup warn against using resources for sinful purposes, encouraging faithful stewardship
The beast blesses those who give generously to it
The woman shares her wealth with the saints
The kings demand tithes from the faithful
questions.correctAnswer: The abominations in the golden cup warn against using resources for sinful purposes, encouraging faithful stewardship
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:4 shows the golden cup full of abominations, reminding believers to use their resources in ways pleasing to God rather than corrupt systems.

questions.question: What biblical truth about marriage and family life can be drawn from the imagery of the ‘great whore’ and her corrupt influence in Revelation 17?
options: Avoid entanglement with corrupt influences that can defile family faith and loyalty
The great whore is a model for family unity
The ten horns represent family members
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid entanglement with corrupt influences that can defile family faith and loyalty
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:1-2 warns about spiritual fornication with corrupt powers, teaching believers to guard family faith against worldly corruption.

hard.title: Revelation Chapter 17 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Revelation Chapter 17.

questions.question: In Revelation 17, the woman is described as sitting upon what kind of beast?
questions.correctAnswer: A scarlet coloured beast
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:3 describes the woman sitting upon a scarlet coloured beast, full of names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns.

questions.question: What is written on the forehead of the woman in Revelation 17?
options: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH
HOLY CITY, THE BRIDE, THE LAMB'S WIFE
THE CITY OF GOD, THE TEMPLE OF THE MOST HIGH
THE SEVEN CHURCHES, THE FAITHFUL WITNESSES
questions.correctAnswer: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:5 explicitly states that on her forehead was written this name, identifying her symbolic identity and role.

questions.question: According to Revelation 17, the seven heads of the beast represent what?
questions.correctAnswer: Seven mountains
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:9 explains that the seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman sitteth, a symbolic reference often understood as the city of Rome, historically known for being built on seven hills.

questions.question: How many kings are described in Revelation 17:10, and what is their status?
options: Seven kings: five fallen, one is, one not yet come
questions.correctAnswer: Seven kings: five fallen, one is, one not yet come
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:10 describes seven kings with a temporal sequence: five have fallen, one is reigning, and the last has not yet come, reflecting a prophetic timeline.

questions.question: The beast that was, is not, and yet is, is said to be which number king according to Revelation 17?
questions.correctAnswer: The eighth king
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:11 states that the beast that was, is not, and yet is, is the eighth, and is of the seven, indicating a figure beyond the seven kings mentioned earlier.

questions.question: What do the ten horns on the beast represent in Revelation 17?
options: Ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:12 explains that the ten horns are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom but will receive authority with the beast for a short time.

questions.question: Which statement best describes the relationship between the ten kings and the beast in Revelation 17?
options: They have one mind and give their power to the beast
They oppose the beast and wage war against it
They are unaware of the beast’s existence
They serve only themselves and not the beast
questions.correctAnswer: They have one mind and give their power to the beast
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:13 states that these ten kings have a singular mind and give their power and authority to the beast, signifying a unified alliance.

questions.question: According to Revelation 17, who will make war with the Lamb, and what is the outcome?
options: The ten kings will make war with the Lamb, but the Lamb will overcome them
The woman will make war with the Lamb and defeat him
The angels will make war with the Lamb and be defeated
The saints will make war with the Lamb and lose
questions.correctAnswer: The ten kings will make war with the Lamb, but the Lamb will overcome them
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:14 explains that the ten kings allied with the beast make war with the Lamb, but the Lamb, who is Lord of lords and King of kings, overcomes them.

questions.question: What do the 'many waters' or 'waters' represent where the great whore sits, as explained in Revelation 17?
questions.correctAnswer: Peoples, multitudes, nations, and tongues
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:15 clarifies that the waters where the woman sits symbolize peoples, multitudes, nations, and tongues, indicating widespread influence.

questions.question: The ten horns (kings) will do what to the great whore according to Revelation 17?
options: Hate her, make her desolate and naked, eat her flesh, and burn her with fire
Protect her and support her reign
Ignore her and focus on their own kingdoms
Seek to marry her and ally with her
questions.correctAnswer: Hate her, make her desolate and naked, eat her flesh, and burn her with fire
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:16 describes the ten horns turning against the woman, destroying her completely as part of God's sovereign plan.

questions.question: What is the divine reason behind the ten kings’ actions against the woman in Revelation 17?
options: God has put it into their hearts to fulfill His will
They act out of personal vengeance
They are deceived by the woman
questions.correctAnswer: God has put it into their hearts to fulfill His will
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:17 explains that God orchestrates these events by putting the desire into their hearts to carry out His sovereign will until His words are fulfilled.

questions.question: The woman is identified as what in Revelation 17:18?
options: That great city which reigneth over the kings of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: That great city which reigneth over the kings of the earth
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:18 reveals that the woman symbolizes a great city with political and spiritual dominance over earthly kings.

questions.question: True or False: The woman in Revelation 17 is described as being intoxicated with the blood of the saints and martyrs of Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:6 clearly depicts the woman as drunken with the blood of the saints and the martyrs of Jesus, symbolizing persecution.

questions.question: What literary device is predominantly used in Revelation 17 to describe the woman and the beast?
questions.correctAnswer: Symbolism
questions.explanation: The chapter uses rich symbolism, such as the woman, the beast with seven heads and ten horns, and the waters, to convey complex spiritual and political realities (Revelation 17:3-15).

questions.question: The phrase 'the beast that was, and is not, and yet is' in Revelation 17:8 alludes to which Old Testament concept or figure?
options: The Leviathan as a symbol of chaos
The resurrection concept linked to Daniel’s beasts
questions.correctAnswer: The resurrection concept linked to Daniel’s beasts
questions.explanation: This phrase echoes Daniel’s apocalyptic visions where beasts rise, fall, and rise again, symbolizing kingdoms and powers with cyclical or resurrected influence (cf. Daniel 7).

theological.title: Revelation Chapter 17 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Revelation Chapter 17 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who is the 'great whore' mentioned in Revelation 17, and upon what does she sit?
options: A woman sitting upon many waters
A woman sitting upon a scarlet coloured beast
A king ruling over many nations
questions.correctAnswer: A woman sitting upon a scarlet coloured beast
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:1-3 describes a woman called the 'great whore' who sits upon a scarlet coloured beast. This imagery shows her as a corrupt entity riding the beast, symbolizing her dominion and influence. This symbolism is consistent with Old Testament prophetic imagery where beasts often represent kingdoms (Daniel 7:7-8; Jeremiah 51:7) and women symbolize cities or nations (Isaiah 47:5-6).

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'seven heads' of the beast in Revelation 17?
options: They represent seven mountains where the woman sits
They symbolize seven angels of God
They are seven churches in Asia
They are seven days of creation
questions.correctAnswer: They represent seven mountains where the woman sits
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:9 explicitly states that the seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman sits. This is consistent with biblical symbolism where mountains often represent kingdoms or empires (Daniel 2:35; Psalm 72:3). The seven heads indicate a foundation of political or worldly power.

questions.question: According to Revelation 17, what does the name written on the woman's forehead signify?
options: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH
questions.correctAnswer: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:5 identifies the name on the woman's forehead as 'MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH,' signifying a corrupt and idolatrous system opposed to God. Babylon in Scripture often symbolizes opposition to God’s kingdom (Isaiah 13:19; Jeremiah 51:7).

questions.question: What does the angel say the waters where the woman sits represent?
questions.correctAnswer: Peoples, multitudes, nations, and tongues
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:15 explains that the waters on which the woman sits represent peoples, multitudes, nations, and tongues, indicating widespread influence and dominion over diverse groups. This aligns with Old Testament imagery where waters symbolize peoples and nations (Daniel 7:2; Jeremiah 51:13).

questions.question: How does Revelation 17 describe the relationship between the beast and the ten horns?
options: The ten horns are ten kings who give their power to the beast
The ten horns are angels protecting the beast
The ten horns are seven churches allied with the beast
The ten horns are seven kings opposing the beast
questions.correctAnswer: The ten horns are ten kings who give their power to the beast
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:12-13 states that the ten horns are ten kings who have not yet received kingdoms but will receive authority for a short time and give their power to the beast. This represents earthly political powers cooperating with evil, similar to prophetic images in Daniel 7:24.

questions.question: What happens to the woman according to the ten horns' actions in Revelation 17?
options: They hate her, make her desolate and naked, eat her flesh, and burn her with fire
They worship her alongside the beast
questions.correctAnswer: They hate her, make her desolate and naked, eat her flesh, and burn her with fire
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:16 describes the ten horns turning against the woman, desolating and destroying her by burning her with fire. This indicates that corrupt worldly powers ultimately turn against the corrupt system she represents. This theme of judgment on wickedness is consistent with Ezekiel 23:25 and Jeremiah 51:30.

questions.question: Who will overcome the ten kings and the beast according to Revelation 17?
options: The Lamb, who is Lord of lords and King of kings
questions.correctAnswer: The Lamb, who is Lord of lords and King of kings
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:14 states that the Lamb will overcome the ten kings and the beast because He is Lord of lords and King of kings. This affirms Christ's ultimate sovereignty and victory over evil, consistent with passages like 1 Timothy 6:15 and Psalm 110:1.

questions.question: What does the beast that 'was, and is not, and yet is' symbolize in Revelation 17?
options: A power that existed, was destroyed, and will return
An angel guarding the seven churches
A false prophet in the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: A power that existed, was destroyed, and will return
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:8 and 17:11 describe the beast as one that 'was, and is not, and yet is,' symbolizing a kingdom or power that had dominion, lost it, and will return briefly before final judgment. This theme aligns with prophetic cycles in Daniel (Daniel 7:8, 11) showing kingdoms rising and falling under God's sovereign plan.

questions.question: What does the angel reveal as the purpose of the ten kings giving their kingdom to the beast?
options: To fulfill the words of God
questions.correctAnswer: To fulfill the words of God
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:17 says that God has put it in the hearts of the ten kings to give their power to the beast to fulfill His purpose. This shows the sovereignty of God over even evil plans, consistent with Isaiah 10:5-7 and Romans 8:28.

questions.question: What is the nature of the woman’s 'golden cup' and what does it contain?
options: A cup full of abominations and filthiness of her fornication
A cup full of pure water
A cup of the blood of the saints
questions.correctAnswer: A cup full of abominations and filthiness of her fornication
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:4 describes the woman holding a golden cup full of abominations and filthiness, symbolizing corruption and idolatry. This image recalls Old Testament condemnation of idolatry and spiritual adultery (Jeremiah 51:7; Ezekiel 23:37).

questions.question: What does the woman’s drunkenness symbolize in Revelation 17?
options: Drunkenness with the blood of the saints and martyrs of Jesus
Joy and celebration of the Lamb
Spiritual intoxication with the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Drunkenness with the blood of the saints and martyrs of Jesus
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:6 states the woman is drunken with the blood of the saints and martyrs, symbolizing her persecution and killing of the faithful. This reflects the theme of suffering and martyrdom in Revelation (Revelation 6:9-11) and Old Testament persecutions (Psalm 79:10).

questions.question: How does the angel respond when John marvels at the woman and the beast in Revelation 17?
options: He says he will tell John the mystery of the woman and the beast
He rebukes John for his lack of faith
He tells John to ignore the vision
He sends John away from the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: He says he will tell John the mystery of the woman and the beast
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:7 shows the angel telling John he will reveal the mystery behind the woman and the beast, highlighting the revelatory nature of prophecy. This aligns with biblical instances where angels explain visions (Daniel 8:16; Luke 1:19).

questions.question: In Revelation 17, how many kings are described and what is notable about their reigns?
options: Seven kings: five fallen, one now, one yet to come for a short time
Twelve kings divided into two groups
questions.correctAnswer: Seven kings: five fallen, one now, one yet to come for a short time
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:10 describes seven kings, five fallen, one present, and one future who will reign briefly. This reflects God’s sovereign control over history and kingdoms, consistent with Daniel’s visions of successive empires (Daniel 2:31-45).

questions.question: What does Revelation 17 state about those dwelling on the earth in relation to the beast?
options: They shall wonder when they see the beast that was, is not, and yet is
They will worship the Lamb only
They will be saved by faith
They will be protected by the woman
questions.correctAnswer: They shall wonder when they see the beast that was, is not, and yet is
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:8 explains that those not written in the book of life will marvel at the beast’s return, indicating confusion and deception among the ungodly. This reflects themes of judgment and deception in Scripture (2 Thessalonians 2:9-12; Psalm 2:1-3).

questions.question: What title does Revelation 17 give to the woman symbolizing the corrupt city?
options: The great city which reigneth over the kings of the earth
questions.correctAnswer: The great city which reigneth over the kings of the earth
questions.explanation: Revelation 17:18 identifies the woman as the great city ruling over the kings of the earth, showing her political and spiritual influence. This contrasts with the New Jerusalem as the city of God’s reign (Revelation 21:2).
